title: What do you think about J-hope of BTS? - Quora

response.answer_text: I just have one: J-Hope is not the mystery that everyone claims him to be. I’m not saying that I know him personally, but from reading his song lyrics, watching his interviews, etc., I think I understand J-Hope more than most ARMYs. When I first got into BTS, I didn’t think too much of him. I thought he was always pretty calm until I saw him on Good Morning America lol. Personally, I do prefer calm and serious Hobi to Sunshine Hobi, although I don’t mind the latter. Moving onto the main point of this answer. . . A common “complaint” that people make about J-Hope is that he’s not open enough about his past, his struggles, and his feelings with ARMYs - I would beg to differ. His past: Again, I don’t know J-Hope personally, but from the looks of it, he seemed to have grown up in a relatively happy and supportive household. J-Hope and his sister openly share photos of them together and with their families all the time. They look happy. Trainee struggles aside, maybe J-Hope just didn’t have those kinds of obstacles (e.g. unsupportive parents, poverty) like the other BTS members. Consequently, he doesn’t talk about them. His struggles: J-Hope seems like one of those people who sucks it up and pushes through all the pain and obstacles until he reaches the other side. He doesn’t like to bring them up because he doesn’t want to burden others with his worries. It might not be healthy, but it’s how he deals with challenges, and there’s nothing wrong with that. Hobi might not directly tell ARMYs he’s worried or about his vulnerabilities via VLives, interviews, etc., however, I do think he is telling us indirectly through his song lyrics. For example, in Jamais Vu, J-Hope’s rap: It'd be better if it was a gameBecause it hurts so muchI need to heal my medicBut I'm another starBlame myself since I was imperfectBrake in my head, brake in my step, alwaysAll I wanted was to do wellI wanted to make you smile... damn ^^ I’m going to assume that J-Hope wrote this because he did rap this part and he was listed as the second writer after Hitman Bang. The lines in bold - I think it’s a clue right there of J-Hope trying to tell us something. Please correct me if I’m wrong, but I was told that this was a song for ARMYs? Even if it was for us, those words just don’t come out of thin air. Again, I am not J-Hope nor do I know him personally, but he must have been feeling something not good to write those lyrics down. Although he smiles all the time and is a ball of sunshine, perhaps deep down he was never completely satisfied with himself :,( I won’t go into detail about it here because that would just be a novel of an answer, but I think Hobi’s struggles, feelings, and personality were made clear in his mixtape, Hope World. It featured multiple aspects of him that I don’t think most people have seen before. His feelings: As mentioned above, Hobi is not one to come out often about his feelings. However, when he does, oh boy, you better prepare your boxes of tissues. He is an emotional mess when he cries and you can just see how much stress he’s been holding in since day one. He hides his feelings underneath his bright smile, but when he shows them, he REALLY unleashes them. Just look at him during the 2019 MAMA Daesang win. I dunno. . . maybe it’s just because I’m the same way, so I kind of understand? Anyhow, those were my two cents. Was this even unpopular? I’m not sure. Maybe I’m just simple-minded and take things at face-value, so I don’t look to deep into each BTS member’s character. I just don’t think J-Hope is a mystery. . . His character seems pretty evident through his lyrics to me :/ I know ARMYs want to get to know the “real” J-Hope beyond Sunshine Man, but I think how he is now, is the “real” Hobi: Happy when needed, serious when not needed. If it’s not, then it’s fine - stop asking him to tell us more about himself. If he doesn’t want to, respect his privacy and let him be. He does enough for us already. If you have a different take on this, feel free to respectfully express them down in the comments below. I’m interested in hearing what you have to say. Apologies if none of this made sense, but it’s 1:30AM where I am. I don’t sleep much so my brain is kind of mush right now. I’m also terrible at expressing my “deep” thoughts and feelings, so again, sorry if I didn’t express myself well enough. I’m working on it. I’ll be back to edit this answer and clarify things when I have more time. Good night.
